HomePage.vehicle_title: The Sustainable Campus Management Center (SCMC) is the main agency driving the university towards becoming a smart and sustainable city by integrating technology and innovation in physical aspects, environment, energy, transportation, and safety. The center plays a role in managing basic infrastructure systems such as electricity, water supply, and wastewater treatment, including promoting clean energy and developing smart transportation systems within the university, to sustainably enhance the quality of life for students, staff, and the surrounding community.

AboutPage.about_title: The Sustainable Campus Management Center (SCMC) at Chiang Mai University is the main agency driving Chiang Mai University towards becoming a Smart & Sustainable City. It integrates technology, innovation, and data for efficient resource management, covering environmental aspects, energy, transportation, safety, and infrastructure within the university. The center plays a role in managing basic utility systems such as electricity, water supply, wastewater, and buildings, as well as promoting clean energy, energy conservation, and green technology. It develops and manages smart public transportation systems, such as the CMU Transit electric shuttle. It supports green spaces, systematic waste management, and carbon footprint reduction. It monitors and evaluates through a real-time Dashboard and Smart Sensor system to create transparency and accountability in management at all levels. It promotes the participation of students, staff, and network partners in designing development approaches, creating a model of an “Eco-University” that is friendly to the environment and community. It serves as a testing ground for sustainability policies for expansion to city and national levels, under the concept of “Smart – Sustainable – Safe” in a systematic and balanced manner, for a good quality of life for everyone in the university and the surrounding community sustainably.
AboutPage.vision_title: To be a model university city management center, driven by smart technology for environmental sustainability, energy, transportation, and the quality of life for everyone in the university in a balanced way.

mission_points.1: Manage infrastructure and resources efficiently and sustainably.
mission_points.2: Develop information technology systems for smart city management.
mission_points.3: Promote clean energy, resource conservation, and waste reduction.
mission_points.4: Support smart transportation systems and safe access to areas.
mission_points.5: Foster community participation in the sustainable development of the university city.
